message.body: Ah - we are a
Er, we are back on again!
P
The hottest contest, or at least the noisiest 1, is for City Controller or a similar title.
decide and just gives some hyperlinks. She sends out a newsletter by email twice a year to people who are interested.
There are 3 candidates. One is negligible. The other 2 both have strong arguments pro & con, & the friend whose advice I rely on in these says she can't
I mentioned the name and said " No relation!" because his last name is the same as mine.
At the neighborhood monthly Gentlemen's Night Out dinner that a friend of mine organizes, somebody couldn't remember the name of one of the candidates.
I decided not to vote at all in that contest.
Ah
Makes sense to me
Gonna be in a meeting into about 2:30
Ttfn
. :-( Ttfn
And just now I was in am unplanned one. Head of Systems came over to help me try to recover some lost files. No dice, alas, so I'll have to rebuild them
Oy!
Yeah. But it's not as dumb a goof as I thought. Seems that some daily snapshots failed and the error message wasn't "loud" enough to get to the attentio
n of the guy in charge of patching up. They're improving their procedures.
I just said it should take me about 3 days to redo, so I have my work set put for me right there.
Your timing is good, b/c i was just heading down to the deli on the ground floor of my ofc bldg for a delayed lunch, and I'm sitting there eating it now
: chicken salad wrap on a spinach tortilla. It's a good place. Called The Nosh, but not kosher or -style.
It's run by a really sweet hard-working Korean couple.
How did your meeting go?
Went well
Now trying to finish editing a manuscript written in British English.
Hoo boy, pitfall country. subject area?
